I suggest you try Align and trying to eliminate sugar from your diet.  Get tested for diabetes.

The feelings of anxiety may be related to low blood sugar, especially since you have a family history of it and because you say it tends to hit you 2-3 hours after eating.  Low blood sugar can make you shaky, irritable, etc. which can feel a lot like an anxiety attack.I would suggest definitely geting your blood sugar tested - probably a glucose tolerance test as opposed to a simple blood glucose test.  Also get the white patches checked out - if it's an infection, that can also sometime cause shakiness, etc. due to your body trying to fight the infection (which again can feel like anxiety)

The white tongue is caused by yeast overgrowth.  This is common in diabetic people, although other people can get it.  Diabetes is common and you need to get checked for it ASAP.  For the anxiety, try deep breathing and walking for exercise, but if your weight is up you're going to need to switch to a healthy diet and increase your exercise tolerance.  But make the call to get your blood sugar checked tomorrow.
